verses.verse: Then answered <S%H6030><s%> Zophar <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite <S%H5284><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
Therefore do my thoughts <S%H5587><s%> cause me to answer <S%H7725><s%>, and for this I make haste <S%H2363><s%>.
I have heard <S%H8085><s%> the check <S%H4148><s%> of my reproach <S%H3639><s%>, and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of my understanding <S%H998><s%> causes me to answer <S%H6030><s%>.
Know <S%H3045><s%> you not this of old <S%H5703><s%>, since man <S%H120><s%> was placed <S%H7760><s%> upon earth <S%H776><s%>,
That the triumphing <S%H7445><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is short <S%H7138><s%>, and the joy <S%H8057><s%> of the hypocrite <S%H2611><s%> but for a moment <S%H7281><s%>?
Though his excellency <S%H7863><s%> mountain up <S%H5927><s%> to the heavens <S%H8064><s%>, and his head <S%H7218><s%> reach <S%H5060><s%> unto the clouds <S%H5645><s%>;
Yet he shall perish <S%H6><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%> like his own dung <S%H1561><s%>: they which have seen <S%H7200><s%> him shall say <S%H559><s%>, Where is he <S%H335><s%>?
He shall fly away <S%H5774><s%> as a dream <S%H2472><s%>, and shall not be found <S%H4672><s%>: Yes <S%H5074><s%>, he shall be chased away as a vision <S%H2384><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%>.
The eye <S%H5869><s%> also which saw <S%H7805><s%> him shall see him no more <S%H3254><s%>; neither shall his place <S%H4725><s%> any more behold him <S%H7789><s%>.
His sons <S%H1121><s%> shall seek to please <S%H7521><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%>, and his hands <S%H3027><s%> shall restore <S%H7725><s%> their goods <S%H202><s%>.
His bones <S%H6106><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of the sin of his youth <S%H5934><s%>, which shall lie down <S%H7901><s%> with him in the dust <S%H6083><s%>.
Though wickedness <S%H7451><s%> be sweet <S%H4985><s%> in his mouth <S%H6310><s%>, though he hide <S%H3582><s%> it under his tongue <S%H3956><s%>;
Though he spare <S%H2550><s%> it <S%H5800><s%>, and forsake it not <S%H4513><s%>; but keep it still inside <S%H8432><s%> his mouth <S%H2441><s%>:
Yet his food <S%H3899><s%> in his bowels <S%H4578><s%> is turned <S%H2015><s%>, it is the gall <S%H4846><s%> of asps <S%H6620><s%> inside him <S%H7130><s%>.
He has swallowed down <S%H1104><s%> riches <S%H2428><s%>, and he shall vomit them up again <S%H6958><s%>: God <S%H410><s%> shall cast them out <S%H3423><s%> of his belly <S%H990><s%>.
He shall suck <S%H3243><s%> the poison <S%H7219><s%> of asps <S%H6620><s%>: the viper <S%H660><s%>'s tongue <S%H3956><s%> shall kill him <S%H2026><s%>.
He shall not see <S%H7200><s%> the rivers <S%H6390><s%>, the floods <S%H5104><s%>, the brooks <S%H5158><s%> of honey <S%H1706><s%> and butter <S%H2529><s%>.

That which he labored <S%H3022><s%> for shall he restore <S%H7725><s%>, and shall not swallow it down <S%H1104><s%>: according to his substance <S%H2428><s%> shall the restitution <S%H8545><s%> be <S%H5965><s%>, and he shall not rejoice in it.

Because he has oppressed <S%H7533><s%> and has forsaken <S%H5800><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%>; because he has violently taken away <S%H1497><s%> an house <S%H1004><s%> which he built not <S%H1129><s%>;
Surely he shall not feel <S%H3045><s%> quietness <S%H7961><s%> in his belly <S%H990><s%>, he shall not save <S%H4422><s%> of that which he desired <S%H2530><s%>.
There shall none of his food <S%H400><s%> be left <S%H8300><s%>; therefore shall no man look <S%H2342><s%> for his goods <S%H2898><s%>.
In the fullness <S%H4390><s%> of his sufficiency <S%H5607><s%> he shall be in straits <S%H3334><s%>: every hand <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked <S%H6001><s%> shall come upon him <S%H935><s%>.

When he is about to fill <S%H4390><s%> his belly <S%H990><s%>, God shall cast <S%H7971><s%> the fury <S%H2740><s%> of his wrath <S%H639><s%> upon him <S%H4305><s%>, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating <S%H3894><s%>.
He shall flee <S%H1272><s%> from the iron <S%H1270><s%> weapon <S%H5402><s%>, and the bow <S%H7198><s%> of steel <S%H5154><s%> shall strike him through <S%H2498><s%>.

It is drawn <S%H8025><s%>, and comes out <S%H3318><s%> of the body <S%H1465><s%>; Yes <S%H1300><s%>, the glittering sword comes out <S%H1980><s%> of his gall <S%H4846><s%>: terrors are upon him <S%H367><s%>.

All darkness <S%H2822><s%> shall be hid <S%H2934><s%> in his secret places <S%H6845><s%>: a fire <S%H784><s%> not blown <S%H5301><s%> shall consume <S%H398><s%> him <S%H3415><s%>; it shall go ill with him that is left <S%H8300><s%> in his tabernacle <S%H168><s%>.
The heaven <S%H8064><s%> shall reveal <S%H1540><s%> his iniquity <S%H5771><s%>; and the earth <S%H776><s%> shall rise up against him <S%H6965><s%>.
The increase <S%H2981><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%> shall depart <S%H1540><s%>, and his goods shall flow away <S%H5064><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of his wrath <S%H639><s%>.
This is the portion <S%H2506><s%> of a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H120><s%> from God <S%H430><s%>, and the heritage <S%H5159><s%> appointed <S%H561><s%> unto him by God <S%H410><s%>.
